eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Informed Consent
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Signed Informed Consent Form

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Age Requirement
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Age 18 years at time of signing Informed Consent Form

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Compliance
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Ability to comply with the study protocol, in the investigator's judgment

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: HCC Diagnosis
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Locally advanced or metastatic and/or unresectable HCC with diagnosis confirmed by histology/cytology or clinically by American Association for the Study of Liver Diseases (AASLD) criteria in cirrhotic patients. Patients without cirrhosis require histological confirmation of diagnosis.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Disease Status
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Disease that is not amenable to curative surgical and/or locoregional therapies, or progressive disease after surgical and /or locoregional therapies

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Prior Systemic Therapy
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: No prior systemic therapy (including systemic investigational agents) for HCC. Previous use of herbal therapies/traditional Chinese medicines with anti-cancer activity included in the label is allowed, provided that these medications are discontinued prior to randomization.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Measurable Disease
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: At least 1 measurable (per RECIST 1.1) untreated lesion

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Prior Local Therapy
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Patients who received prior local therapy (e.g., radiofrequency ablation, percutaneous ethanol or acetic acid injection, cryoablation, high-intensity focused ultrasound, transarterial chemoembolization, transarterial embolization, etc.) are eligible provided the target lesion(s) have not been previously treated with local therapy or the target lesion(s) within the field of local therapy have subsequently progressed in accordance with RECIST v1.1

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Tumor Tissue
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Pretreatment tumor tissue sample (if available). If tumor tissue is available, a formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded (FFPE) tumor specimen in a paraffin block (preferred) or approximately 1015 slides containing unstained, freshly cut, serial sections should be submitted along with an associated pathology report within 4 weeks of randomization. If FFPE specimens described above are not available, any type of specimens (including fine-needle aspiration, cell pellet specimens [e.g., from pleural effusion], and lavage samples) are also acceptable. This specimen should be accompanied by the associated pathology report. If tumor tissue is not available (e.g., depleted because of prior diagnostic testing), patients are still eligible.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: ECOG Performance Status
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status of 0 or 1 within 7 days prior to randomization

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Child-Pugh Class
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Child-Pugh Class A within 7 days prior to randomization

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Hematologic and End-organ Function
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Adequate hematologic and end-organ function, defined by the following laboratory test results, obtained within 7 days prior to randomization, unless otherwise specified: ANC 1.5 109/L (1500/L) without granulocyte colony-stimulating factor support; Lymphocyte count 0.5 109/L (500/L); Platelet count 75109/L (75,000/L) without transfusion; Hemoglobin 90 g/L (9 g/dL); AST, ALT, and alkaline phosphatase (ALP) 5upper limit of normal (ULN); Serum bilirubin 3ULN; Serum creatinine 1.5ULN or creatinine clearance 50 mL/min (calculated using the Cockcroft-Gault formula); Serum albumin 28 g/L (2.8 g/dL) without transfusion; For patients not receiving therapeutic anticoagulation: INR or aPTT 2ULN; Urine dipstick for proteinuria 2(within 7 days prior to initiation of study treatment).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Toxicity Resolution
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Resolution of any acute, clinically significant treatment-related toxicity from prior therapy to Grade 1 prior to study entry, with the exception of alopecia

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: HIV Status
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Negative HIV test at screening

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Hepatitis Virology
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Documented virology status of hepatitis, as confirmed by screening hepatitis B virus (HBV) and hepatitis C virus (HCV) serology test

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Active HBV Management
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: For patients with active HBV: HBV DNA 500 IU/mL obtained within 28 days prior to initiation of study treatment, and Anti-HBV treatment (per local standard of care; e.g., entecavir) for a minimum of 14 days prior to study entry and willingness to continue treatment for the length of the study

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Contraception - Women
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: For women of childbearing potential: agreement to remain abstinent (refrain from heterosexual intercourse) or use contraceptive methods with a failure rate of 1% per year during the treatment period and for at least 5 months after the last dose of atezolizumab, 6 months after the last dose of bevacizumab, or 6 months after the last dose of sorafenib. Women must refrain from donating eggs during this same period.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Contraception - Men
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: For men: agreement to remain abstinent (refrain from heterosexual intercourse) or use contraceptive measures, and agreement to refrain from donating sperm, as defined below: With female partners of childbearing potential, men must remain abstinent or use a condom plus an additional contraceptive method that together result in a failure rate of 1% per year during the treatment period and for 6 months after the last dose of bevacizumab or 3 months after the last dose of sorafenib. Men must refrain from donating sperm during this same period. With pregnant female partners, men must remain abstinent or use a condom during the treatment period and for 6 months after the last dose of bevacizumab or 3 months after the last dose of sorafenib to avoid exposing the embryo.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: China Enrollment Phase
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: For the extended China enrollment phase: Chinese ancestry and residence in Mainland China, Hong Kong, or Taiwan with enrollment at sites recognized by the China Center for Drug Evaluation

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Leptomeningeal Disease
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of leptomeningeal disease

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Autoimmune Disease
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Active or history of autoimmune disease or immune deficiency, including, but not limited to, myasthenia gravis, myositis, autoimmune hepatitis, systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis, inflammatory bowel disease, antiphospholipid antibody syndrome, Wegener granulomatosis, Sjögren syndrome, Guillain-Barré syndrome, or multiple sclerosis, with specific exceptions for hypothyroidism, Type 1 diabetes, and certain dermatologic conditions.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Pulmonary Conditions
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, organizing pneumonia (e.g., bronchiolitis obliterans), drug-induced pneumonitis, or idiopathic pneumonitis, or evidence of active pneumonitis on screening chest computed tomography (CT) scan. History of radiation pneumonitis in the radiation field (fibrosis) is permitted.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Active Tuberculosis
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Known active tuberculosis

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Cardiovascular Disease
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Significant cardiovascular disease (such as New York Heart Association Class II or greater cardiac disease, myocardial infarction, or cerebrovascular accident within 3 months prior to initiation of study treatment), unstable arrhythmia, or unstable angina

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: QT Interval
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of congenital long QT syndrome or corrected QT interval 500 ms (calculated with use of the Fridericia method) at screening

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Electrolyte Disorder
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of uncorrectable electrolyte disorder affecting serum levels of potassium, calcium, or magnesium

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Major Surgery
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Major surgical procedure, other than for diagnosis, within 4 weeks prior to initiation of study treatment, or anticipation of need for a major surgical procedure during the study

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Other Malignancy
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of malignancy other than HCC within 5 years prior to screening, with the exception of malignancies with a negligible risk of metastasis or death (e.g., 5-year overall survival [OS] rate 90%), such as adequately treated carcinoma in situ of the cervix, non-melanoma skin carcinoma, localized prostate cancer, ductal carcinoma in situ, or Stage I uterine cancer

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Severe Infection
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Severe infection within 4 weeks prior to initiation of study treatment, including, but not limited to, hospitalization for complications of infection, bacteremia, or severe pneumonia, or any active infection that, in the opinion of the investigator, could impact patient safety

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Antibiotic Treatment
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Treatment with therapeutic oral or IV antibiotics within 2 weeks prior to initiation of study treatment. Patients receiving prophylactic antibiotics are eligible.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Transplantation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Prior allogeneic stem cell or solid organ transplantation

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Other Contraindications
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Any other disease, metabolic dysfunction, physical examination finding, or clinical laboratory finding that contraindicates the use of an investigational drug, may affect the interpretation of the results, or may render the patient at high risk from treatment complications

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Live Vaccine
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Treatment with a live, attenuated vaccine within 4 weeks prior to initiation of study treatment, or anticipation of need for such a vaccine during atezolizumab treatment or within 5 months after the last dose of atezolizumab

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Anaphylactic Reactions
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of severe allergic anaphylactic reactions to chimeric or humanized antibodies or fusion proteins

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Hypersensitivity
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Known hypersensitivity to Chinese hamster ovary cell products or to any component of the atezolizumab or bevacizumab formulation

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Pregnancy and Breastfeeding
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Pregnant or breastfeeding, or intention of becoming pregnant during study treatment or within at least 5 months after the last dose of atezolizumab, 6 months after the last dose of bevacizumab, or 6 months after the last dose of sorafenib. Women of childbearing potential must have a negative serum pregnancy test result within 14 days prior to initiation of study treatment.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Specific HCC Types
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Known fibrolamellar HCC, sarcomatoid HCC, or mixed cholangiocarcinoma and HCC

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Varices
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Untreated or incompletely treated esophageal and/or gastric varices with bleeding or high risk for bleeding. Patients must undergo an EGD, and all size of varices must be assessed and treated per local standard of care prior to enrollment.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Prior Bleeding Event
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: A prior bleeding event due to esophageal and/or gastric varices within 6 months prior to initiation of study treatment

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Ascites
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Moderate or severe ascites

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Hepatic Encephalopathy
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of hepatic encephalopathy

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: HBV and HCV Coinfection
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Coinfection of HBV and HCV. Patients with a history of HCV infection but who are negative for HCV RNA by PCR will be considered non-infected with HCV.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: CNS Metastases
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Symptomatic, untreated, or actively progressing CNS metastases. Asymptomatic patients with treated CNS lesions are eligible under specific conditions (measurable disease outside CNS, no hemorrhage history, limited location, no interim progression, no recent radiotherapy/surgery, no ongoing corticosteroids).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Tumor-related Pain
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Uncontrolled tumor-related pain. Patients requiring pain medication must be on a stable regimen at study entry.

population.name: Study Population
population.description: Target population defined by eligibility criteria
